mdRecord.dcterms:title: Apothecary scale set
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Samuel Freeman [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:medium: brass (alloy); metal; wood (plant material); string (fiber product); paper (fiber product) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Contained in wooden and fabric box; peeling label on inside of box: Samuel Freeman [ ] Hall Street, London; Wilie Davis loaned to A. Davis July 1829, handwritten on inside of box; set includes: 2-plate apothecary scale; 4 round weights, different sizes; 7 square weights, varying sizes; 1 square thin plate; 1 bent nail.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Scales (Weighing instruments)
Technology, Pharmaceutical
